ai.summary: Crab Lane is a short, easy 3 km hike in the UK suitable for beginners. The route typically features gentle terrain and minimal elevation gain, making it a relaxed choice for a daytime outdoor stroll. The exact regional setting is not specified.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect flat or gently rolling paths, likely a mix of gravel tracks, grassy lanes, and possibly mud after rain. The region is unknown, so terrain can vary; bring suitable footwear and be prepared for changing conditions.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast before starting; UK conditions can change quickly. Wear sturdy footwear, stay on marked paths, and be mindful of mud or puddles. If the path is shared with cyclists or horse riders, give way and stay to the side. Carry a phone or map, tell someone your plan, and bring water and a small first-aid item for minor injuries.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate clothing (layers, waterproof shell if rain is forecast)
Map or offline navigation (or fully charged phone with GPS)
Light rain protection (packable poncho or rain jacket)
ai.best_seasons: All year round with proper gear; spring and summer offer the driest, most comfortable conditions, while autumn can be pleasant though wetter and muddier.
